meta_description: The mission of the Art Museum of Greater Lafayette is to celebrate the power of art to inspire, instruct, challenge, and build community through collections, exhibitions, events, educational and cultural programs.
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

**Admission is free!** The museum is open 7 days a week from 11:00am – 4:00pm except on all major holidays. The galleries are closed during exhibit installation.

[ Schedule a Docent Tour! ](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeiWOTbVlfiifBgPM8cjU2uhv681sQlowLR_ocqiSAxtlNO_g/viewform?usp=sf_link)

### Location and Parking

Our main entrance is located at 102 South 10th Street, Lafayette, IN 47905. You can reach 10th Street via South Street or Kossuth Street.

It’s free to park in our lot on 10th Street. Additional street parking is available on 10th and 9th Streets. 

**We also have ADA-accessible parking on 9th Street.**

Explore the Museum

  * ## Explore the Art

There’s always something new to view at the Art Museum with exhibitions rotating every 3-6 months. 

[See Exhibits](/exhibits)

  * ## Attend an Event

From Friday Night Live musical performances to artists’ talks and opening receptions, many of our events are free to the public. 

[See Events](/calendar)

  * ## Take a Class

The Art Museum offers a variety of classes to students with varying experience levels such as pottery, basket weaving, and watercolor painting. 

[See Classes](/classes)

  * ## Visit the Gift Shop

Find a unique gift for a loved one, or yourself, at the Art Museum’s gift shop! Shop local artists’ prints, jewelry, and more. 

See Gift Shop

### Docent Tours

The Art Museum of Greater Lafayette invites you to discover its galleries year-round! We welcome the opportuni...

collections_text:
#### Discover the captivating life of a Permanent Collection artist

# Exploring the Collection: Alice Baber

**February 17 | 6:00-7:00 PM | At the Art Museum of Greater Lafayette**

Join us for an insightful exploration of abstract expressionist painter Alice Baber. Explore her extensive works from our Permanent Collection on display in the Weil Gallery, and be inspired by renowned speakers traveling from across America as they discuss her life and lasting influence on the art world.

Enjoy themed cocktails at our cash bar, along with light hors d'oeuvres. Whether an art lover or a newcomer, we hope to see you there!

[ Reserve your Spot ](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/exploring-the-collection-alice-baber-symposium-registration-1965555920670?aff=oddtdtcreator)

[ Opening Reception for Exhibit ](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1978288812091?aff=oddtdtcreator)

#### **Open 7 days a week 11:00a - 4:00p**

#### **Free admission daily**

#### [**Plan your visit →**](/visit)

Current Exhibits

  * ## Charles Gick: "The Earth Moves Through Us"

**East Gallery**

** _October 4, 2025 - February 22, 2026_**

Charles A. Gick is an interdisciplinary artist who combines and moves between painting, video, performance, photography, sculpture, and installation art. His work continues to receive both national and international recognition. He was the first recipient of the Purdue University Affiliated Fellowship at the American Academy in Rome.
